5 * Copyright (c) 1995 Tatu Ylonen <ylo@cs.hut.fi>, Espoo, Finland

7 * This program is the ssh daemon. It listens for connections from clients,
8 * and performs authentication, executes use commands or shell, and forwards
9 * information to/from the application to the user client over an encrypted
10 * connection. This can also handle forwarding of X11, TCP/IP, and
11 * authentication agent connections.

17 * called by a name other than "ssh" or "Secure Shell".
18 *
19 * SSH2 implementation:
20 * Privilege Separation:
21 *
22 * Copyright (c) 2000, 2001, 2002 Markus Friedl. All rights reserved.
23 * Copyright (c) 2002 Niels Provos. All rights reserved.
24 *

29 * notice, this list of conditions and the following disclaimer.

31 * notice, this list of conditions and the following disclaimer in the
32 * documentation and/or other materials provided with the distribution.

34 * THIS SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED BY THE AUTHOR ``AS IS'' AND ANY EXPRESS OR

130/* Re-exec fds */
131#define REEXEC_DEVCRYPTO_RESERVED_FD (STDERR_FILENO + 1)
132#define REEXEC_STARTUP_PIPE_FD (STDERR_FILENO + 2)

134#define REEXEC_MIN_FREE_FD (STDERR_FILENO + 4)

136extern char *__progname;
137
138/* Server configuration options. */
139ServerOptions options;
140
141/* Name of the server configuration file. */
142const char *config_file_name = _PATH_SERVER_CONFIG_FILE;
143
144/*
145 * Debug mode flag. This can be set on the command line. If debug
146 * mode is enabled, extra debugging output will be sent to the system
147 * log, the daemon will not go to background, and will exit after processing
148 * the first connection.
149 */
150int debug_flag = 0;
151
152/*
153 * Indicating that the daemon should only test the configuration and keys.
154 * If test_flag > 1 ("-T" flag), then sshd will also dump the effective
155 * configuration, optionally using connection information provided by the
156 * "-C" flag.
157 */
158static int test_flag = 0;
159
160/* Flag indicating that the daemon is being started from inetd. */
161static int inetd_flag = 0;
162
163/* Flag indicating that sshd should not detach and become a daemon. */
164static int no_daemon_flag = 0;
165
166/* debug goes to stderr unless inetd_flag is set */
167static int log_stderr = 0;
168
169/* Saved arguments to main(). */
170static char **saved_argv;
171
172/* re-exec */
173static int rexeced_flag = 0;
174static int rexec_flag = 1;
175static int rexec_argc = 0;
176static char **rexec_argv;
177
178/*
179 * The sockets that the server is listening; this is used in the SIGHUP
180 * signal handler.
181 */
182#define MAX_LISTEN_SOCKS 16
183static int listen_socks[MAX_LISTEN_SOCKS];
184static int num_listen_socks = 0;
185
186/* Daemon's agent connection */
187int auth_sock = -1;
188static int have_agent = 0;
189
190/*
191 * Any really sensitive data in the application is contained in this
192 * structure. The idea is that this structure could be locked into memory so
193 * that the pages do not get written into swap. However, there are some
194 * problems. The private key contains BIGNUMs, and we do not (in principle)
195 * have access to the internals of them, and locking just the structure is
196 * not very useful. Currently, memory locking is not implemented.
197 */
198struct {
199 struct sshkey **host_keys; /* all private host keys */
200 struct sshkey **host_pubkeys; /* all public host keys */
201 struct sshkey **host_certificates; /* all public host certificates */
202 int have_ssh2_key;
203} sensitive_data;
204
205/* This is set to true when a signal is received. */
206static volatile sig_atomic_t received_sighup = 0;
207static volatile sig_atomic_t received_sigterm = 0;
208
209/* session identifier, used by RSA-auth */
210u_char session_id[16];
211
212/* same for ssh2 */
213u_char *session_id2 = NULL;
214u_int session_id2_len = 0;
215
216/* record remote hostname or ip */
217u_int utmp_len = HOST_NAME_MAX+1;
218
219/*
220 * startup_pipes/flags are used for tracking children of the listening sshd
221 * process early in their lifespans. This tracking is needed for three things:
222 *
223 * 1) Implementing the MaxStartups limit of concurrent unauthenticated
224 * connections.
225 * 2) Avoiding a race condition for SIGHUP processing, where child processes
226 * may have listen_socks open that could collide with main listener process
227 * after it restarts.
228 * 3) Ensuring that rexec'd sshd processes have received their initial state
229 * from the parent listen process before handling SIGHUP.
230 *
231 * Child processes signal that they have completed closure of the listen_socks
232 * and (if applicable) received their rexec state by sending a char over their
233 * sock. Child processes signal that authentication has completed by closing
234 * the sock (or by exiting).
235 */
236static int *startup_pipes = NULL;
237static int *startup_flags = NULL; /* Indicates child closed listener */
238static int startup_pipe = -1; /* in child */
239
240/* variables used for privilege separation */
241int use_privsep = -1;
242struct monitor *pmonitor = NULL;
243int privsep_is_preauth = 1;
244
245/* global connection state and authentication contexts */
246Authctxt *the_authctxt = NULL;
247struct ssh *the_active_state;
248
249/* global key/cert auth options. XXX move to permanent ssh->authctxt? */
250struct sshauthopt *auth_opts = NULL;
251
252/* sshd_config buffer */
253struct sshbuf *cfg;
254
255/* message to be displayed after login */
256struct sshbuf *loginmsg;
257
258/* Prototypes for various functions defined later in this file. */
259void destroy_sensitive_data(void);
260void demote_sensitive_data(void);
261static void do_ssh2_kex(struct ssh *);
262
263/*
264 * Close all listening sockets
265 */
266static void
267close_listen_socks(void)
268{
269 int i;
270
271 for (i = 0; i < num_listen_socks; i++)
272 close(listen_socks[i]);
273 num_listen_socks = -1;
274}
275
276static void
277close_startup_pipes(void)
278{
279 int i;
280
281 if (startup_pipes)
282 for (i = 0; i < options.max_startups; i++)
283 if (startup_pipes[i] != -1)
284 close(startup_pipes[i]);
285}
286
287/*
288 * Signal handler for SIGHUP. Sshd execs itself when it receives SIGHUP;
289 * the effect is to reread the configuration file (and to regenerate
290 * the server key).
291 */
292
293/*ARGSUSED*/
294static void
295sighup_handler(int sig)
296{
297 int save_errno = errno;
298
299 received_sighup = 1;
300 errno = save_errno;
301}
302
303/*
304 * Called from the main program after receiving SIGHUP.
305 * Restarts the server.
306 */
307__dead static void
308sighup_restart(void)
309{
310 logit("Received SIGHUP; restarting.");
311 if (options.pid_file != NULL)
312 unlink(options.pid_file);
313 close_listen_socks();
314 close_startup_pipes();
315 alarm(0); /* alarm timer persists across exec */
316 signal(SIGHUP, SIG_IGN); /* will be restored after exec */
317 execv(saved_argv[0], saved_argv);
318 logit("RESTART FAILED: av[0]='%.100s', error: %.100s.", saved_argv[0],
319 strerror(errno));
320 exit(1);
321}
322
323/*
324 * Generic signal handler for terminating signals in the master daemon.
325 */
326/*ARGSUSED*/
327static void
328sigterm_handler(int sig)
329{
330 received_sigterm = sig;
331}
332
333/*
334 * SIGCHLD handler. This is called whenever a child dies. This will then
335 * reap any zombies left by exited children.
336 */
337/*ARGSUSED*/
338static void
339main_sigchld_handler(int sig)
340{
341 int save_errno = errno;
342 pid_t pid;
343 int status;
344
345 while ((pid = waitpid(-1, &status, WNOHANG)) > 0 ||
346 (pid < 0 && errno == EINTR))
347 ;
348 errno = save_errno;
349}
350
351/*
352 * Signal handler for the alarm after the login grace period has expired.
353 */
354/*ARGSUSED*/
355__dead static void
356grace_alarm_handler(int sig)
357{
358 pfilter_notify(1);
359 if (use_privsep && pmonitor != NULL && pmonitor->m_pid > 0)
360 kill(pmonitor->m_pid, SIGALRM);
361
362 /*
363 * Try to kill any processes that we have spawned, E.g. authorized
364 * keys command helpers.
365 */
366 if (getpgid(0) == getpid()) {
367 signal(SIGTERM, SIG_IGN);
368 killpg(0, SIGTERM);
369 }
370
371 /* XXX pre-format ipaddr/port so we don't need to access active_state */
372 /* Log error and exit. */
373 sigdie("Timeout before authentication for %s port %d",
374 ssh_remote_ipaddr(the_active_state),
375 ssh_remote_port(the_active_state));
376}
377
378/* Destroy the host and server keys. They will no longer be needed. */
379void
380destroy_sensitive_data(void)
381{
382 u_int i;
383
384 for (i = 0; i < options.num_host_key_files; i++) {
385 if (sensitive_data.host_keys[i]) {
386 sshkey_free(sensitive_data.host_keys[i]);
387 sensitive_data.host_keys[i] = NULL;
388 }
389 if (sensitive_data.host_certificates[i]) {
390 sshkey_free(sensitive_data.host_certificates[i]);
391 sensitive_data.host_certificates[i] = NULL;
392 }
393 }
394}
395
396/* Demote private to public keys for network child */
397void
398demote_sensitive_data(void)
399{
400 struct sshkey *tmp;
401 u_int i;
402 int r;
403
404 for (i = 0; i < options.num_host_key_files; i++) {
405 if (sensitive_data.host_keys[i]) {
406 if ((r = sshkey_from_private(
407 sensitive_data.host_keys[i], &tmp)) != 0)
408 fatal("could not demote host %s key: %s",
409 sshkey_type(sensitive_data.host_keys[i]),
410 ssh_err(r));
411 sshkey_free(sensitive_data.host_keys[i]);
412 sensitive_data.host_keys[i] = tmp;
413 }
414 /* Certs do not need demotion */
415 }
416}
417
418static void
419privsep_preauth_child(void)
420{
421 gid_t gidset[1];
422 struct passwd *pw;
423
424 /* Enable challenge-response authentication for privilege separation */
425 privsep_challenge_enable();
426
427#ifdef GSSAPI
428 /* Cache supported mechanism OIDs for later use */
429 ssh_gssapi_prepare_supported_oids();
430#endif
431
432 /* Demote the private keys to public keys. */
433 demote_sensitive_data();
434
435 /* Demote the child */
436 if (getuid() == 0 || geteuid() == 0) {
437 if ((pw = getpwnam(SSH_PRIVSEP_USER)) == NULL)
438 fatal("Privilege separation user %s does not exist",
439 SSH_PRIVSEP_USER);
440 pw = pwcopy(pw); /* Ensure mutable */
441 endpwent();
442 freezero(pw->pw_passwd, strlen(pw->pw_passwd));
443
444 /* Change our root directory */
445 if (chroot(_PATH_PRIVSEP_CHROOT_DIR) == -1)
446 fatal("chroot(\"%s\"): %s", _PATH_PRIVSEP_CHROOT_DIR,
447 strerror(errno));
448 if (chdir("/") == -1)
449 fatal("chdir(\"/\"): %s", strerror(errno));
450
451 /*
452 * Drop our privileges
453 * NB. Can't use setusercontext() after chroot.
454 */
455 debug3("privsep user:group %u:%u", (u_int)pw->pw_uid,
456 (u_int)pw->pw_gid);
457 gidset[0] = pw->pw_gid;
458 if (setgroups(1, gidset) < 0)
459 fatal("setgroups: %.100s", strerror(errno));
460 permanently_set_uid(pw);
461 }
462}
463
464static int
465privsep_preauth(struct ssh *ssh)
466{
467 int status, r;
468 pid_t pid;
469 struct ssh_sandbox *box = NULL;
470
471 /* Set up unprivileged child process to deal with network data */
472 pmonitor = monitor_init();
473 /* Store a pointer to the kex for later rekeying */
474 pmonitor->m_pkex = &ssh->kex;
475
476 if (use_privsep == PRIVSEP_ON)
477 box = ssh_sandbox_init();
478 pid = fork();
479 if (pid == -1) {
480 fatal("fork of unprivileged child failed");
481 } else if (pid != 0) {
482 debug2("Network child is on pid %ld", (long)pid);
483
484 pmonitor->m_pid = pid;
485 if (have_agent) {
486 r = ssh_get_authentication_socket(&auth_sock);
487 if (r != 0) {
488 error("Could not get agent socket: %s",
489 ssh_err(r));
490 have_agent = 0;
491 }
492 }
493 if (box != NULL)
494 ssh_sandbox_parent_preauth(box, pid);
495 monitor_child_preauth(ssh, pmonitor);
496
497 /* Wait for the child's exit status */
498 while (waitpid(pid, &status, 0) < 0) {
499 if (errno == EINTR)
500 continue;
501 pmonitor->m_pid = -1;
502 fatal("%s: waitpid: %s", __func__, strerror(errno));
503 }
504 privsep_is_preauth = 0;
505 pmonitor->m_pid = -1;
506 if (WIFEXITED(status)) {
507 if (WEXITSTATUS(status) != 0)
508 fatal("%s: preauth child exited with status %d",
509 __func__, WEXITSTATUS(status));
510 } else if (WIFSIGNALED(status))
511 fatal("%s: preauth child terminated by signal %d",
512 __func__, WTERMSIG(status));
513 if (box != NULL)
514 ssh_sandbox_parent_finish(box);
515 return 1;
516 } else {
517 /* child */
518 close(pmonitor->m_sendfd);
519 close(pmonitor->m_log_recvfd);
520
521 /* Arrange for logging to be sent to the monitor */
522 set_log_handler(mm_log_handler, pmonitor);
523
524 privsep_preauth_child();
525 setproctitle("%s", "[net]");
526 if (box != NULL)
527 ssh_sandbox_child(box);
528
529 return 0;
530 }
531}
532
533static void
534privsep_postauth(struct ssh *ssh, Authctxt *authctxt)
535{
536 ssh->authctxt = authctxt;
537 if (authctxt->pw->pw_uid == 0) {
538 /* File descriptor passing is broken or root login */
539 use_privsep = 0;
540 goto skip;
541 }
542
543 /* New socket pair */
544 monitor_reinit(pmonitor);
545
546 pmonitor->m_pid = fork();
547 if (pmonitor->m_pid == -1)
548 fatal("fork of unprivileged child failed");
549 else if (pmonitor->m_pid != 0) {
550 verbose("User child is on pid %ld", (long)pmonitor->m_pid);
551 sshbuf_reset(loginmsg);
552 monitor_clear_keystate(ssh, pmonitor);
553 monitor_child_postauth(ssh, pmonitor);
554
555 /* NEVERREACHED */
556 exit(0);
557 }
558
559 /* child */
560
561 close(pmonitor->m_sendfd);
562 pmonitor->m_sendfd = -1;
563
564 /* Demote the private keys to public keys. */
565 demote_sensitive_data();
566
567 /* Drop privileges */
568 do_setusercontext(authctxt->pw);
569
570 skip:
571 /* It is safe now to apply the key state */
572 monitor_apply_keystate(ssh, pmonitor);
573
574 /*
575 * Tell the packet layer that authentication was successful, since
576 * this information is not part of the key state.
577 */
578 ssh_packet_set_authenticated(ssh);
579}
580
581static void
582append_hostkey_type(struct sshbuf *b, const char *s)
583{
584 int r;
585
586 if (match_pattern_list(s, options.hostkeyalgorithms, 0) != 1) {
587 debug3("%s: %s key not permitted by HostkeyAlgorithms",
588 __func__, s);
589 return;
590 }
591 if ((r = sshbuf_putf(b, "%s%s", sshbuf_len(b) > 0 ? "," : "", s)) != 0)
592 fatal("%s: sshbuf_putf: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
593}
594
595static char *
596list_hostkey_types(void)
597{
598 struct sshbuf *b;
599 struct sshkey *key;
600 char *ret;
601 u_int i;
602
603 if ((b = sshbuf_new()) == NULL)
604 fatal("%s: sshbuf_new failed", __func__);
605 for (i = 0; i < options.num_host_key_files; i++) {
606 key = sensitive_data.host_keys[i];
607 if (key == NULL)
608 key = sensitive_data.host_pubkeys[i];
609 if (key == NULL)
610 continue;
611 switch (key->type) {
612 case KEY_RSA:
613 /* for RSA we also support SHA2 signatures */
614 append_hostkey_type(b, "rsa-sha2-512");
615 append_hostkey_type(b, "rsa-sha2-256");
616 /* FALLTHROUGH */
617 case KEY_DSA:
618 case KEY_ECDSA:
619 case KEY_ED25519:
620 case KEY_XMSS:
621 append_hostkey_type(b, sshkey_ssh_name(key));
622 break;
623 }
624 /* If the private key has a cert peer, then list that too */
625 key = sensitive_data.host_certificates[i];
626 if (key == NULL)
627 continue;
628 switch (key->type) {
629 case KEY_RSA_CERT:
630 /* for RSA we also support SHA2 signatures */
631 append_hostkey_type(b,
632 "rsa-sha2-512-cert-v01@openssh.com");
633 append_hostkey_type(b,
634 "rsa-sha2-256-cert-v01@openssh.com");
635 /* FALLTHROUGH */
636 case KEY_DSA_CERT:
637 case KEY_ECDSA_CERT:
638 case KEY_ED25519_CERT:
639 case KEY_XMSS_CERT:
640 append_hostkey_type(b, sshkey_ssh_name(key));
641 break;
642 }
643 }
644 if ((ret = sshbuf_dup_string(b)) == NULL)
645 fatal("%s: sshbuf_dup_string failed", __func__);
646 sshbuf_free(b);
647 debug("%s: %s", __func__, ret);
648 return ret;
649}
650
651static struct sshkey *
652get_hostkey_by_type(int type, int nid, int need_private, struct ssh *ssh)
653{
654 u_int i;
655 struct sshkey *key;
656
657 for (i = 0; i < options.num_host_key_files; i++) {
658 switch (type) {
659 case KEY_RSA_CERT:
660 case KEY_DSA_CERT:
661 case KEY_ECDSA_CERT:
662 case KEY_ED25519_CERT:
663 case KEY_XMSS_CERT:
664 key = sensitive_data.host_certificates[i];
665 break;
666 default:
667 key = sensitive_data.host_keys[i];
668 if (key == NULL && !need_private)
669 key = sensitive_data.host_pubkeys[i];
670 break;
671 }
672 if (key != NULL && key->type == type &&
673 (key->type != KEY_ECDSA || key->ecdsa_nid == nid))
674 return need_private ?
675 sensitive_data.host_keys[i] : key;
676 }
677 return NULL;
678}
679
680struct sshkey *
681get_hostkey_public_by_type(int type, int nid, struct ssh *ssh)
682{
683 return get_hostkey_by_type(type, nid, 0, ssh);
684}
685
686struct sshkey *
687get_hostkey_private_by_type(int type, int nid, struct ssh *ssh)
688{
689 return get_hostkey_by_type(type, nid, 1, ssh);
690}
691
692struct sshkey *
693get_hostkey_by_index(int ind)
694{
695 if (ind < 0 || (u_int)ind >= options.num_host_key_files)
696 return (NULL);
697 return (sensitive_data.host_keys[ind]);
698}
699
700struct sshkey *
701get_hostkey_public_by_index(int ind, struct ssh *ssh)
702{
703 if (ind < 0 || (u_int)ind >= options.num_host_key_files)
704 return (NULL);
705 return (sensitive_data.host_pubkeys[ind]);
706}
707
708int
709get_hostkey_index(struct sshkey *key, int compare, struct ssh *ssh)
710{
711 u_int i;
712
713 for (i = 0; i < options.num_host_key_files; i++) {
714 if (sshkey_is_cert(key)) {
715 if (key == sensitive_data.host_certificates[i] ||
716 (compare && sensitive_data.host_certificates[i] &&
717 sshkey_equal(key,
718 sensitive_data.host_certificates[i])))
719 return (i);
720 } else {
721 if (key == sensitive_data.host_keys[i] ||
722 (compare && sensitive_data.host_keys[i] &&
723 sshkey_equal(key, sensitive_data.host_keys[i])))
724 return (i);
725 if (key == sensitive_data.host_pubkeys[i] ||
726 (compare && sensitive_data.host_pubkeys[i] &&
727 sshkey_equal(key, sensitive_data.host_pubkeys[i])))
728 return (i);
729 }
730 }
731 return (-1);
732}
733
734/* Inform the client of all hostkeys */
735static void
736notify_hostkeys(struct ssh *ssh)
737{
738 struct sshbuf *buf;
739 struct sshkey *key;
740 u_int i, nkeys;
741 int r;
742 char *fp;
743
744 /* Some clients cannot cope with the hostkeys message, skip those. */
745 if (ssh->compat & SSH_BUG_HOSTKEYS)
746 return;
747
748 if ((buf = sshbuf_new()) == NULL)
749 fatal("%s: sshbuf_new", __func__);
750 for (i = nkeys = 0; i < options.num_host_key_files; i++) {
751 key = get_hostkey_public_by_index(i, ssh);
752 if (key == NULL || key->type == KEY_UNSPEC ||
753 sshkey_is_cert(key))
754 continue;
755 fp = sshkey_fingerprint(key, options.fingerprint_hash,
756 SSH_FP_DEFAULT);
757 debug3("%s: key %d: %s %s", __func__, i,
758 sshkey_ssh_name(key), fp);
759 free(fp);
760 if (nkeys == 0) {
761 /*
762 * Start building the request when we find the
763 * first usable key.
764 */
765 if ((r = sshpkt_start(ssh, SSH2_MSG_GLOBAL_REQUEST)) != 0 ||
766 (r = sshpkt_put_cstring(ssh, "hostkeys-00@openssh.com")) != 0 ||
767 (r = sshpkt_put_u8(ssh, 0)) != 0) /* want reply */
768 sshpkt_fatal(ssh, r, "%s: start request", __func__);
769 }
770 /* Append the key to the request */
771 sshbuf_reset(buf);
772 if ((r = sshkey_putb(key, buf)) != 0)
773 fatal("%s: couldn't put hostkey %d: %s",
774 __func__, i, ssh_err(r));
775 if ((r = sshpkt_put_stringb(ssh, buf)) != 0)
776 sshpkt_fatal(ssh, r, "%s: append key", __func__);
777 nkeys++;
778 }
779 debug3("%s: sent %u hostkeys", __func__, nkeys);
780 if (nkeys == 0)
781 fatal("%s: no hostkeys", __func__);
782 if ((r = sshpkt_send(ssh)) != 0)
783 sshpkt_fatal(ssh, r, "%s: send", __func__);
784 sshbuf_free(buf);
785}
786
787/*
788 * returns 1 if connection should be dropped, 0 otherwise.
789 * dropping starts at connection #max_startups_begin with a probability
790 * of (max_startups_rate/100). the probability increases linearly until
791 * all connections are dropped for startups > max_startups
792 */
793static int
794drop_connection(int startups)
795{
796 int p, r;
797
798 if (startups < options.max_startups_begin)
799 return 0;
800 if (startups >= options.max_startups)
801 return 1;
802 if (options.max_startups_rate == 100)
803 return 1;
804
805 p = 100 - options.max_startups_rate;
806 p *= startups - options.max_startups_begin;
807 p /= options.max_startups - options.max_startups_begin;
808 p += options.max_startups_rate;
809 r = arc4random_uniform(100);
810
811 debug("drop_connection: p %d, r %d", p, r);
812 return (r < p) ? 1 : 0;
813}
814
815__dead static void
816usage(void)
817{
818 fprintf(stderr, "%s, %s\n",
819 SSH_VERSION,
820#ifdef WITH_OPENSSL
821 OpenSSL_version(OPENSSL_VERSION)
822#else
823 "without OpenSSL"
824#endif
825 );
826 fprintf(stderr,
827"usage: sshd [-46DdeiqTt] [-C connection_spec] [-c host_cert_file]\n"
828" [-E log_file] [-f config_file] [-g login_grace_time]\n"
829" [-h host_key_file] [-o option] [-p port] [-u len]\n"
830 );
831 exit(1);
832}
833
834static void
835send_rexec_state(int fd, struct sshbuf *conf)
836{
837 struct sshbuf *m;
838 int r;
839
840 debug3("%s: entering fd = %d config len %zu", __func__, fd,
841 sshbuf_len(conf));
842
843 /*
844 * Protocol from reexec master to child:
845 * string configuration
846 */
847 if ((m = sshbuf_new()) == NULL)
848 fatal("%s: sshbuf_new failed", __func__);
849 if ((r = sshbuf_put_stringb(m, conf)) != 0)
850 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
851 if (ssh_msg_send(fd, 0, m) == -1)
852 fatal("%s: ssh_msg_send failed", __func__);
853
854 sshbuf_free(m);
855
856 debug3("%s: done", __func__);
857}
858
859static void
860recv_rexec_state(int fd, struct sshbuf *conf)
861{
862 struct sshbuf *m;
863 u_char *cp, ver;
864 size_t len;
865 int r;
866
867 debug3("%s: entering fd = %d", __func__, fd);
868
869 if ((m = sshbuf_new()) == NULL)
870 fatal("%s: sshbuf_new failed", __func__);
871 if (ssh_msg_recv(fd, m) == -1)
872 fatal("%s: ssh_msg_recv failed", __func__);
873 if ((r = sshbuf_get_u8(m, &ver)) != 0)
874 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
875 if (ver != 0)
876 fatal("%s: rexec version mismatch", __func__);
877 if ((r = sshbuf_get_string(m, &cp, &len)) != 0)
878 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
879 if (conf != NULL && (r = sshbuf_put(conf, cp, len)))
880 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
881
882 free(cp);
883 sshbuf_free(m);
884
885 debug3("%s: done", __func__);
886}
887
888/* Accept a connection from inetd */
889static void
890server_accept_inetd(int *sock_in, int *sock_out)
891{
892 int fd;
893
894 if (rexeced_flag) {
895 close(REEXEC_CONFIG_PASS_FD);
896 *sock_in = *sock_out = dup(STDIN_FILENO);
897 } else {
898 *sock_in = dup(STDIN_FILENO);
899 *sock_out = dup(STDOUT_FILENO);
900 }
901 /*
902 * We intentionally do not close the descriptors 0, 1, and 2
903 * as our code for setting the descriptors won't work if
904 * ttyfd happens to be one of those.
905 */
906 if ((fd = open(_PATH_DEVNULL, O_RDWR, 0)) != -1) {
907 dup2(fd, STDIN_FILENO);
908 dup2(fd, STDOUT_FILENO);
909 if (!log_stderr)
910 dup2(fd, STDERR_FILENO);
911 if (fd > (log_stderr ? STDERR_FILENO : STDOUT_FILENO))
912 close(fd);
913 }
914 debug("inetd sockets after dupping: %d, %d", *sock_in, *sock_out);
915}
916
917/*
918 * Listen for TCP connections
919 */
920static void
921listen_on_addrs(struct listenaddr *la)
922{
923 int ret, listen_sock;
924 struct addrinfo *ai;
925 char ntop[NI_MAXHOST], strport[NI_MAXSERV];
926 int socksize;
927 socklen_t socksizelen = sizeof(int);
928
929 for (ai = la->addrs; ai; ai = ai->ai_next) {
930 if (ai->ai_family != AF_INET && ai->ai_family != AF_INET6)
931 continue;
932 if (num_listen_socks >= MAX_LISTEN_SOCKS)
933 fatal("Too many listen sockets. "
934 "Enlarge MAX_LISTEN_SOCKS");
935 if ((ret = getnameinfo(ai->ai_addr, ai->ai_addrlen,
936 ntop, sizeof(ntop), strport, sizeof(strport),
937 NI_NUMERICHOST|NI_NUMERICSERV)) != 0) {
938 error("getnameinfo failed: %.100s",
939 ssh_gai_strerror(ret));
940 continue;
941 }
942 /* Create socket for listening. */
943 listen_sock = socket(ai->ai_family, ai->ai_socktype,
944 ai->ai_protocol);
945 if (listen_sock < 0) {
946 /* kernel may not support ipv6 */
947 verbose("socket: %.100s", strerror(errno));
948 continue;
949 }
950 if (set_nonblock(listen_sock) == -1) {
951 close(listen_sock);
952 continue;
953 }
954 if (fcntl(listen_sock, F_SETFD, FD_CLOEXEC) == -1) {
955 verbose("socket: CLOEXEC: %s", strerror(errno));
956 close(listen_sock);
957 continue;
958 }
959 /* Socket options */
960 set_reuseaddr(listen_sock);
961 if (la->rdomain != NULL &&
962 set_rdomain(listen_sock, la->rdomain) == -1) {
963 close(listen_sock);
964 continue;
965 }
966
967 debug("Bind to port %s on %s.", strport, ntop);
968
969 getsockopt(listen_sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_RCVBUF,
970 &socksize, &socksizelen);
971 debug("Server TCP RWIN socket size: %d", socksize);
972 debug("HPN Buffer Size: %d", options.hpn_buffer_size);
973
974 /* Bind the socket to the desired port. */
975 if (bind(listen_sock, ai->ai_addr, ai->ai_addrlen) < 0) {
976 error("Bind to port %s on %s failed: %.200s.",
977 strport, ntop, strerror(errno));
978 close(listen_sock);
979 continue;
980 }
981 listen_socks[num_listen_socks] = listen_sock;
982 num_listen_socks++;
983
984 /* Start listening on the port. */
985 if (listen(listen_sock, SSH_LISTEN_BACKLOG) < 0)
986 fatal("listen on [%s]:%s: %.100s",
987 ntop, strport, strerror(errno));
988 logit("Server listening on %s port %s%s%s.",
989 ntop, strport,
990 la->rdomain == NULL ? "" : " rdomain ",
991 la->rdomain == NULL ? "" : la->rdomain);
992 }
993}
994
995static void
996server_listen(void)
997{
998 u_int i;
999
1000 for (i = 0; i < options.num_listen_addrs; i++) {
1001 listen_on_addrs(&options.listen_addrs[i]);
1002 freeaddrinfo(options.listen_addrs[i].addrs);
1003 free(options.listen_addrs[i].rdomain);
1004 memset(&options.listen_addrs[i], 0,
1005 sizeof(options.listen_addrs[i]));
1006 }
1007 free(options.listen_addrs);
1008 options.listen_addrs = NULL;
1009 options.num_listen_addrs = 0;
1010
1011 if (!num_listen_socks)
1012 fatal("Cannot bind any address.");
1013}
1014
1015/*
1016 * The main TCP accept loop. Note that, for the non-debug case, returns
1017 * from this function are in a forked subprocess.
1018 */
1019static void
1020server_accept_loop(int *sock_in, int *sock_out, int *newsock, int *config_s)
1021{
1022 fd_set *fdset;
1023 int i, j, ret, maxfd;
1024 int startups = 0, listening = 0, lameduck = 0;
1025 int startup_p[2] = { -1 , -1 };
1026 char c = 0;
1027 struct sockaddr_storage from;
1028 socklen_t fromlen;
1029 pid_t pid;
1030
1031 /* setup fd set for accept */
1032 fdset = NULL;
1033 maxfd = 0;
1034 for (i = 0; i < num_listen_socks; i++)
1035 if (listen_socks[i] > maxfd)
1036 maxfd = listen_socks[i];
1037 /* pipes connected to unauthenticated childs */
1038 startup_pipes = xcalloc(options.max_startups, sizeof(int));
1039 startup_flags = xcalloc(options.max_startups, sizeof(int));
1040 for (i = 0; i < options.max_startups; i++)
1041 startup_pipes[i] = -1;
1042
1043 pfilter_init();
1044 /*
1045 * Stay listening for connections until the system crashes or
1046 * the daemon is killed with a signal.
1047 */
1048 for (;;) {
1049 if (received_sighup) {
1050 if (!lameduck) {
1051 debug("Received SIGHUP; waiting for children");
1052 close_listen_socks();
1053 lameduck = 1;
1054 }
1055 if (listening <= 0)
1056 sighup_restart();
1057 }
1058 free(fdset);
1059 fdset = xcalloc(howmany(maxfd + 1, NFDBITS),
1060 sizeof(fd_mask));
1061
1062 for (i = 0; i < num_listen_socks; i++)
1063 FD_SET(listen_socks[i], fdset);
1064 for (i = 0; i < options.max_startups; i++)
1065 if (startup_pipes[i] != -1)
1066 FD_SET(startup_pipes[i], fdset);
1067
1068 /* Wait in select until there is a connection. */
1069 ret = select(maxfd+1, fdset, NULL, NULL, NULL);
1070 if (ret < 0 && errno != EINTR)
1071 error("select: %.100s", strerror(errno));
1072 if (received_sigterm) {
1073 logit("Received signal %d; terminating.",
1074 (int) received_sigterm);
1075 close_listen_socks();
1076 if (options.pid_file != NULL)
1077 unlink(options.pid_file);
1078 exit(received_sigterm == SIGTERM ? 0 : 255);
1079 }
1080 if (ret < 0)
1081 continue;
1082
1083 for (i = 0; i < options.max_startups; i++) {
1084 if (startup_pipes[i] == -1 ||
1085 !FD_ISSET(startup_pipes[i], fdset))
1086 continue;
1087 switch (read(startup_pipes[i], &c, sizeof(c))) {
1088 case -1:
1089 if (errno == EINTR || errno == EAGAIN)
1090 continue;
1091 if (errno != EPIPE) {
1092 error("%s: startup pipe %d (fd=%d): "
1093 "read %s", __func__, i,
1094 startup_pipes[i], strerror(errno));
1095 }
1096 /* FALLTHROUGH */
1097 case 0:
1098 /* child exited or completed auth */
1099 close(startup_pipes[i]);
1100 startup_pipes[i] = -1;
1101 startups--;
1102 if (startup_flags[i])
1103 listening--;
1104 break;
1105 case 1:
1106 /* child has finished preliminaries */
1107 if (startup_flags[i]) {
1108 listening--;
1109 startup_flags[i] = 0;
1110 }
1111 break;
1112 }
1113 }
1114 for (i = 0; i < num_listen_socks; i++) {
1115 if (!FD_ISSET(listen_socks[i], fdset))
1116 continue;
1117 fromlen = sizeof(from);
1118 *newsock = accept(listen_socks[i],
1119 (struct sockaddr *)&from, &fromlen);
1120 if (*newsock < 0) {
1121 if (errno != EINTR && errno != EWOULDBLOCK &&
1122 errno != ECONNABORTED)
1123 error("accept: %.100s",
1124 strerror(errno));
1125 if (errno == EMFILE || errno == ENFILE)
1126 usleep(100 * 1000);
1127 continue;
1128 }
1129 if (unset_nonblock(*newsock) == -1) {
1130 close(*newsock);
1131 continue;
1132 }
1133 if (drop_connection(startups) == 1) {
1134 char *laddr = get_local_ipaddr(*newsock);
1135 char *raddr = get_peer_ipaddr(*newsock);
1136
1137 verbose("drop connection #%d from [%s]:%d "
1138 "on [%s]:%d past MaxStartups", startups,
1139 raddr, get_peer_port(*newsock),
1140 laddr, get_local_port(*newsock));
1141 free(laddr);
1142 free(raddr);
1143 close(*newsock);
1144 continue;
1145 }
1146 if (pipe(startup_p) == -1) {
1147 close(*newsock);
1148 continue;
1149 }
1150
1151 if (rexec_flag && socketpair(AF_UNIX,
1152 SOCK_STREAM, 0, config_s) == -1) {
1153 error("reexec socketpair: %s",
1154 strerror(errno));
1155 close(*newsock);
1156 close(startup_p[0]);
1157 close(startup_p[1]);
1158 continue;
1159 }
1160
1161 for (j = 0; j < options.max_startups; j++)
1162 if (startup_pipes[j] == -1) {
1163 startup_pipes[j] = startup_p[0];
1164 if (maxfd < startup_p[0])
1165 maxfd = startup_p[0];
1166 startups++;
1167 startup_flags[j] = 1;
1168 break;
1169 }
1170
1171 /*
1172 * Got connection. Fork a child to handle it, unless
1173 * we are in debugging mode.
1174 */
1175 if (debug_flag) {
1176 /*
1177 * In debugging mode. Close the listening
1178 * socket, and start processing the
1179 * connection without forking.
1180 */
1181 debug("Server will not fork when running in debugging mode.");
1182 close_listen_socks();
1183 *sock_in = *newsock;
1184 *sock_out = *newsock;
1185 close(startup_p[0]);
1186 close(startup_p[1]);
1187 startup_pipe = -1;
1188 pid = getpid();
1189 if (rexec_flag) {
1190 send_rexec_state(config_s[0], cfg);
1191 close(config_s[0]);
1192 }
1193 return;
1194 }
1195
1196 /*
1197 * Normal production daemon. Fork, and have
1198 * the child process the connection. The
1199 * parent continues listening.
1200 */
1201 listening++;
1202 if ((pid = fork()) == 0) {
1203 /*
1204 * Child. Close the listening and
1205 * max_startup sockets. Start using
1206 * the accepted socket. Reinitialize
1207 * logging (since our pid has changed).
1208 * We return from this function to handle
1209 * the connection.
1210 */
1211 startup_pipe = startup_p[1];
1212 close_startup_pipes();
1213 close_listen_socks();
1214 *sock_in = *newsock;
1215 *sock_out = *newsock;
1216 log_init(__progname,
1217 options.log_level,
1218 options.log_facility,
1219 log_stderr);
1220 if (rexec_flag)
1221 close(config_s[0]);
1222 else {
1223 /*
1224 * Signal parent that the preliminaries
1225 * for this child are complete. For the
1226 * re-exec case, this happens after the
1227 * child has received the rexec state
1228 * from the server.
1229 */
1230 (void)atomicio(vwrite, startup_pipe,
1231 __UNCONST("\0"), 1);
1232 }
1233 return;
1234 }
1235
1236 /* Parent. Stay in the loop. */
1237 if (pid < 0)
1238 error("fork: %.100s", strerror(errno));
1239 else
1240 debug("Forked child %ld.", (long)pid);
1241
1242 close(startup_p[1]);
1243
1244 if (rexec_flag) {
1245 send_rexec_state(config_s[0], cfg);
1246 close(config_s[0]);
1247 close(config_s[1]);
1248 }
1249 close(*newsock);
1250 }
1251 }
1252}
1253
1254/*
1255 * If IP options are supported, make sure there are none (log and
1256 * return an error if any are found). Basically we are worried about
1257 * source routing; it can be used to pretend you are somebody
1258 * (ip-address) you are not. That itself may be "almost acceptable"
1259 * under certain circumstances, but rhosts authentication is useless
1260 * if source routing is accepted. Notice also that if we just dropped
1261 * source routing here, the other side could use IP spoofing to do
1262 * rest of the interaction and could still bypass security. So we
1263 * exit here if we detect any IP options.
1264 */
1265static void
1266check_ip_options(struct ssh *ssh)
1267{
1268 int sock_in = ssh_packet_get_connection_in(ssh);
1269 struct sockaddr_storage from;
1270 socklen_t fromlen = sizeof(from);
1271#ifdef IP_OPTIONS
1272 socklen_t option_size, i;
1273 u_char opts[200];
1274 socklen_t i, option_size = sizeof(opts), fromlen = sizeof(from);
1275 char text[sizeof(opts) * 3 + 1];
1276#endif
1277
1278 memset(&from, 0, sizeof(from));
1279 if (getpeername(sock_in, (struct sockaddr *)&from,
1280 &fromlen) < 0)
1281 return;
1282 if (from.ss_family != AF_INET)
1283 return;
1284 /* XXX IPv6 options? */
1285#ifdef IP_OPTIONS
1286 if (getsockopt(sock_in, IPPROTO_IP, IP_OPTIONS, opts,
1287 &option_size) >= 0 && option_size != 0) {
1288 text[0] = '\0';
1289 for (i = 0; i < option_size; i++)
1290 snprintf(text + i*3, sizeof(text) - i*3,
1291 " %2.2x", opts[i]);
1292 fatal("Connection from %.100s port %d with IP opts: %.800s",
1293 ssh_remote_ipaddr(ssh), ssh_remote_port(ssh), text);
1294 }
1295#endif
1296 return;
1297}
1298
1299/* Set the routing domain for this process */
1300#if !defined(__OpenBSD__)
1301__dead
1302#endif
1303static void
1304set_process_rdomain(struct ssh *ssh, const char *name)
1305{
1306#if defined(__OpenBSD__)
1307 int rtable, ortable = getrtable();
1308 const char *errstr;
1309
1310 if (name == NULL)
1311 return; /* default */
1312
1313 if (strcmp(name, "%D") == 0) {
1314 /* "expands" to routing domain of connection */
1315 if ((name = ssh_packet_rdomain_in(ssh)) == NULL)
1316 return;
1317 }
1318
1319 rtable = (int)strtonum(name, 0, 255, &errstr);
1320 if (errstr != NULL) /* Shouldn't happen */
1321 fatal("Invalid routing domain \"%s\": %s", name, errstr);
1322 if (rtable != ortable && setrtable(rtable) != 0)
1323 fatal("Unable to set routing domain %d: %s",
1324 rtable, strerror(errno));
1325 debug("%s: set routing domain %d (was %d)", __func__, rtable, ortable);
1326#else /* defined(__OpenBSD__) */
1327 fatal("Unable to set routing domain: not supported in this platform");
1328#endif
1329}
1330
1331static void
1332accumulate_host_timing_secret(struct sshbuf *server_cfg,
1333 const struct sshkey *key)
1334{
1335 static struct ssh_digest_ctx *ctx;
1336 u_char *hash;
1337 size_t len;
1338 struct sshbuf *buf;
1339 int r;
1340
1341 if (ctx == NULL && (ctx = ssh_digest_start(SSH_DIGEST_SHA512)) == NULL)
1342 fatal("%s: ssh_digest_start", __func__);
1343 if (key == NULL) { /* finalize */
1344 /* add server config in case we are using agent for host keys */
1345 if (ssh_digest_update(ctx, sshbuf_ptr(server_cfg),
1346 sshbuf_len(server_cfg)) != 0)
1347 fatal("%s: ssh_digest_update", __func__);
1348 len = ssh_digest_bytes(SSH_DIGEST_SHA512);
1349 hash = xmalloc(len);
1350 if (ssh_digest_final(ctx, hash, len) != 0)
1351 fatal("%s: ssh_digest_final", __func__);
1352 options.timing_secret = PEEK_U64(hash);
1353 freezero(hash, len);
1354 ssh_digest_free(ctx);
1355 ctx = NULL;
1356 return;
1357 }
1358 if ((buf = sshbuf_new()) == NULL)
1359 fatal("%s could not allocate buffer", __func__);
1360 if ((r = sshkey_private_serialize(key, buf)) != 0)
1361 fatal("sshkey_private_serialize: %s", ssh_err(r));
1362 if (ssh_digest_update(ctx, sshbuf_ptr(buf), sshbuf_len(buf)) != 0)
1363 fatal("%s: ssh_digest_update", __func__);
1364 sshbuf_reset(buf);
1365 sshbuf_free(buf);
1366}
1367
1368/*
1369 * Main program for the daemon.
1370 */
1371int
1372main(int ac, char **av)
1373{
1374 struct ssh *ssh = NULL;
1375 extern char *optarg;
1376 extern int optind;
1377 int r, opt, on = 1, already_daemon, remote_port;
1378 int sock_in = -1, sock_out = -1, newsock = -1;
1379 const char *remote_ip, *rdomain;
1380 char *fp, *line, *laddr, *logfile = NULL;
1381 int config_s[2] = { -1 , -1 };
1382 u_int i, j;
1383 u_int64_t ibytes, obytes;
1384 mode_t new_umask;
1385 struct sshkey *key;
1386 struct sshkey *pubkey;
1387 int keytype;
1388 Authctxt *authctxt;
1389 struct connection_info *connection_info = NULL;
1390
1391 ssh_malloc_init(); /* must be called before any mallocs */
1392 /* Save argv. */
1393 saved_argv = av;
1394 rexec_argc = ac;
1395
1396 /* Ensure that fds 0, 1 and 2 are open or directed to /dev/null */
1397 sanitise_stdfd();
1398
1399 /* Initialize configuration options to their default values. */
1400 initialize_server_options(&options);
1401
1402 /* Parse command-line arguments. */
1403 while ((opt = getopt(ac, av,
1404 "C:E:b:c:f:g:h:k:o:p:u:46DQRTdeiqrt")) != -1) {
1405 switch (opt) {
1406 case '4':
1407 options.address_family = AF_INET;
1408 break;
1409 case '6':
1410 options.address_family = AF_INET6;
1411 break;
1412 case 'f':
1413 config_file_name = optarg;
1414 break;
1415 case 'c':
1416 servconf_add_hostcert("[command-line]", 0,
1417 &options, optarg);
1418 break;
1419 case 'd':
1420 if (debug_flag == 0) {
1421 debug_flag = 1;
1422 options.log_level = SYSLOG_LEVEL_DEBUG1;
1423 } else if (options.log_level < SYSLOG_LEVEL_DEBUG3)
1424 options.log_level++;
1425 break;
1426 case 'D':
1427 no_daemon_flag = 1;
1428 break;
1429 case 'E':
1430 logfile = optarg;
1431 /* FALLTHROUGH */
1432 case 'e':
1433 log_stderr = 1;
1434 break;
1435 case 'i':
1436 inetd_flag = 1;
1437 break;
1438 case 'r':
1439 rexec_flag = 0;
1440 break;
1441 case 'R':
1442 rexeced_flag = 1;
1443 inetd_flag = 1;
1444 break;
1445 case 'Q':
1446 /* ignored */
1447 break;
1448 case 'q':
1449 options.log_level = SYSLOG_LEVEL_QUIET;
1450 break;
1451 case 'b':
1452 /* protocol 1, ignored */
1453 break;
1454 case 'p':
1455 options.ports_from_cmdline = 1;
1456 if (options.num_ports >= MAX_PORTS) {
1457 fprintf(stderr, "too many ports.\n");
1458 exit(1);
1459 }
1460 options.ports[options.num_ports++] = a2port(optarg);
1461 if (options.ports[options.num_ports-1] <= 0) {
1462 fprintf(stderr, "Bad port number.\n");
1463 exit(1);
1464 }
1465 break;
1466 case 'g':
1467 if ((options.login_grace_time = convtime(optarg)) == -1) {
1468 fprintf(stderr, "Invalid login grace time.\n");
1469 exit(1);
1470 }
1471 break;
1472 case 'k':
1473 /* protocol 1, ignored */
1474 break;
1475 case 'h':
1476 servconf_add_hostkey("[command-line]", 0,
1477 &options, optarg, 1);
1478 break;
1479 case 't':
1480 test_flag = 1;
1481 break;
1482 case 'T':
1483 test_flag = 2;
1484 break;
1485 case 'C':
1486 connection_info = get_connection_info(ssh, 0, 0);
1487 if (parse_server_match_testspec(connection_info,
1488 optarg) == -1)
1489 exit(1);
1490 break;
1491 case 'u':
1492 utmp_len = (u_int)strtonum(optarg, 0, HOST_NAME_MAX+1+1, NULL);
1493 if (utmp_len > HOST_NAME_MAX+1) {
1494 fprintf(stderr, "Invalid utmp length.\n");
1495 exit(1);
1496 }
1497 break;
1498 case 'o':
1499 line = xstrdup(optarg);
1500 if (process_server_config_line(&options, line,
1501 "command-line", 0, NULL, NULL) != 0)
1502 exit(1);
1503 free(line);
1504 break;
1505 case '?':
1506 default:
1507 usage();
1508 break;
1509 }
1510 }
1511 if (rexeced_flag || inetd_flag)
1512 rexec_flag = 0;
1513 if (!test_flag && rexec_flag && !path_absolute(av[0]))
1514 fatal("sshd re-exec requires execution with an absolute path");
1515 if (rexeced_flag)
1516 r = closefrom(REEXEC_MIN_FREE_FD);
1517 else
1518 r = closefrom(REEXEC_DEVCRYPTO_RESERVED_FD);
1519 if (r == -1)
1520 fatal("closefrom failed: %.200s", strerror(errno));
1521
1522#ifdef WITH_OPENSSL
1523 OpenSSL_add_all_algorithms();
1524#endif
1525
1526 /* If requested, redirect the logs to the specified logfile. */
1527 if (logfile != NULL)
1528 log_redirect_stderr_to(logfile);
1529 /*
1530 * Force logging to stderr until we have loaded the private host
1531 * key (unless started from inetd)
1532 */
1533 log_init(__progname,
1534 options.log_level == SYSLOG_LEVEL_NOT_SET ?
1535 SYSLOG_LEVEL_INFO : options.log_level,
1536 options.log_facility == SYSLOG_FACILITY_NOT_SET ?
1537 SYSLOG_FACILITY_AUTH : options.log_facility,
1538 log_stderr || !inetd_flag);
1539
1540 sensitive_data.have_ssh2_key = 0;
1541
1542 /*
1543 * If we're not doing an extended test do not silently ignore connection
1544 * test params.
1545 */
1546 if (test_flag < 2 && connection_info != NULL)
1547 fatal("Config test connection parameter (-C) provided without "
1548 "test mode (-T)");
1549
1550 /* Fetch our configuration */
1551 if ((cfg = sshbuf_new()) == NULL)
1552 fatal("%s: sshbuf_new failed", __func__);
1553 if (rexeced_flag) {
1554 recv_rexec_state(REEXEC_CONFIG_PASS_FD, cfg);
1555 if (!debug_flag) {
1556 startup_pipe = dup(REEXEC_STARTUP_PIPE_FD);
1557 close(REEXEC_STARTUP_PIPE_FD);
1558 /*
1559 * Signal parent that this child is at a point where
1560 * they can go away if they have a SIGHUP pending.
1561 */
1562 (void)atomicio(vwrite, startup_pipe, __UNCONST("\0"), 1);
1563 }
1564 }
1565 else if (strcasecmp(config_file_name, "none") != 0)
1566 load_server_config(config_file_name, cfg);
1567
1568 parse_server_config(&options, rexeced_flag ? "rexec" : config_file_name,
1569 cfg, NULL);
1570
1571 /* Fill in default values for those options not explicitly set. */
1572 fill_default_server_options(&options);
1573
1574 /* challenge-response is implemented via keyboard interactive */
1575 if (options.challenge_response_authentication)
1576 options.kbd_interactive_authentication = 1;
1577
1578 /* Check that options are sensible */
1579 if (options.authorized_keys_command_user == NULL &&
1580 (options.authorized_keys_command != NULL &&
1581 strcasecmp(options.authorized_keys_command, "none") != 0))
1582 fatal("AuthorizedKeysCommand set without "
1583 "AuthorizedKeysCommandUser");
1584 if (options.authorized_principals_command_user == NULL &&
1585 (options.authorized_principals_command != NULL &&
1586 strcasecmp(options.authorized_principals_command, "none") != 0))
1587 fatal("AuthorizedPrincipalsCommand set without "
1588 "AuthorizedPrincipalsCommandUser");
1589
1590 /*
1591 * Check whether there is any path through configured auth methods.
1592 * Unfortunately it is not possible to verify this generally before
1593 * daemonisation in the presence of Match block, but this catches
1594 * and warns for trivial misconfigurations that could break login.
1595 */
1596 if (options.num_auth_methods != 0) {
1597 for (i = 0; i < options.num_auth_methods; i++) {
1598 if (auth2_methods_valid(options.auth_methods[i],
1599 1) == 0)
1600 break;
1601 }
1602 if (i >= options.num_auth_methods)
1603 fatal("AuthenticationMethods cannot be satisfied by "
1604 "enabled authentication methods");
1605 }
1606
1607 /* Check that there are no remaining arguments. */
1608 if (optind < ac) {
1609 fprintf(stderr, "Extra argument %s.\n", av[optind]);
1610 exit(1);
1611 }
1612
1613#ifdef WITH_LDAP_PUBKEY
1614 /* ldap_options_print(&options.lpk); */
1615 /* XXX initialize/check ldap connection and set *LD */
1616 if (options.lpk.on) {
1617 if (options.lpk.l_conf && (ldap_parse_lconf(&options.lpk) < 0) )
1618 error("[LDAP] could not parse %s", options.lpk.l_conf);
1619 if (ldap_connect(&options.lpk) < 0)
1620 error("[LDAP] could not initialize ldap connection");
1621 }
1622#endif
1623 debug("sshd version %s, %s", SSH_VERSION,
1624#ifdef WITH_OPENSSL
1625 OpenSSL_version(OPENSSL_VERSION)
1626#else
1627 "without OpenSSL"
1628#endif
1629 );
1630
1631 /* load host keys */
1632 sensitive_data.host_keys = xcalloc(options.num_host_key_files,
1633 sizeof(struct sshkey *));
1634 sensitive_data.host_pubkeys = xcalloc(options.num_host_key_files,
1635 sizeof(struct sshkey *));
1636
1637 if (options.host_key_agent) {
1638 if (strcmp(options.host_key_agent, SSH_AUTHSOCKET_ENV_NAME))
1639 setenv(SSH_AUTHSOCKET_ENV_NAME,
1640 options.host_key_agent, 1);
1641 if ((r = ssh_get_authentication_socket(NULL)) == 0)
1642 have_agent = 1;
1643 else
1644 error("Could not connect to agent \"%s\": %s",
1645 options.host_key_agent, ssh_err(r));
1646 }
1647
1648 for (i = 0; i < options.num_host_key_files; i++) {
1649 int ll = options.host_key_file_userprovided[i] ?
1650 SYSLOG_LEVEL_ERROR : SYSLOG_LEVEL_DEBUG1;
1651
1652 if (options.host_key_files[i] == NULL)
1653 continue;
1654 if ((r = sshkey_load_private(options.host_key_files[i], "",
1655 &key, NULL)) != 0 && r != SSH_ERR_SYSTEM_ERROR)
1656 do_log2(ll, "Unable to load host key \"%s\": %s",
1657 options.host_key_files[i], ssh_err(r));
1658 if ((r = sshkey_load_public(options.host_key_files[i],
1659 &pubkey, NULL)) != 0 && r != SSH_ERR_SYSTEM_ERROR)
1660 do_log2(ll, "Unable to load host key \"%s\": %s",
1661 options.host_key_files[i], ssh_err(r));
1662 if (pubkey == NULL && key != NULL)
1663 if ((r = sshkey_from_private(key, &pubkey)) != 0)
1664 fatal("Could not demote key: \"%s\": %s",
1665 options.host_key_files[i], ssh_err(r));
1666 sensitive_data.host_keys[i] = key;
1667 sensitive_data.host_pubkeys[i] = pubkey;
1668
1669 if (key == NULL && pubkey != NULL && have_agent) {
1670 debug("will rely on agent for hostkey %s",
1671 options.host_key_files[i]);
1672 keytype = pubkey->type;
1673 } else if (key != NULL) {
1674 keytype = key->type;
1675 accumulate_host_timing_secret(cfg, key);
1676 } else {
1677 do_log2(ll, "Unable to load host key: %s",
1678 options.host_key_files[i]);
1679 sensitive_data.host_keys[i] = NULL;
1680 sensitive_data.host_pubkeys[i] = NULL;
1681 continue;
1682 }
1683
1684 switch (keytype) {
1685 case KEY_RSA:
1686 case KEY_DSA:
1687 case KEY_ECDSA:
1688 case KEY_ED25519:
1689 case KEY_XMSS:
1690 if (have_agent || key != NULL)
1691 sensitive_data.have_ssh2_key = 1;
1692 break;
1693 }
1694 if ((fp = sshkey_fingerprint(pubkey, options.fingerprint_hash,
1695 SSH_FP_DEFAULT)) == NULL)
1696 fatal("sshkey_fingerprint failed");
1697 debug("%s host key #%d: %s %s",
1698 key ? "private" : "agent", i, sshkey_ssh_name(pubkey), fp);
1699 free(fp);
1700 }
1701 accumulate_host_timing_secret(cfg, NULL);
1702 if (!sensitive_data.have_ssh2_key) {
1703 logit("sshd: no hostkeys available -- exiting.");
1704 exit(1);
1705 }
1706
1707 /*
1708 * Load certificates. They are stored in an array at identical
1709 * indices to the public keys that they relate to.
1710 */
1711 sensitive_data.host_certificates = xcalloc(options.num_host_key_files,
1712 sizeof(struct sshkey *));
1713 for (i = 0; i < options.num_host_key_files; i++)
1714 sensitive_data.host_certificates[i] = NULL;
1715
1716 for (i = 0; i < options.num_host_cert_files; i++) {
1717 if (options.host_cert_files[i] == NULL)
1718 continue;
1719 if ((r = sshkey_load_public(options.host_cert_files[i],
1720 &key, NULL)) != 0) {
1721 error("Could not load host certificate \"%s\": %s",
1722 options.host_cert_files[i], ssh_err(r));
1723 continue;
1724 }
1725 if (!sshkey_is_cert(key)) {
1726 error("Certificate file is not a certificate: %s",
1727 options.host_cert_files[i]);
1728 sshkey_free(key);
1729 continue;
1730 }
1731 /* Find matching private key */
1732 for (j = 0; j < options.num_host_key_files; j++) {
1733 if (sshkey_equal_public(key,
1734 sensitive_data.host_keys[j])) {
1735 sensitive_data.host_certificates[j] = key;
1736 break;
1737 }
1738 }
1739 if (j >= options.num_host_key_files) {
1740 error("No matching private key for certificate: %s",
1741 options.host_cert_files[i]);
1742 sshkey_free(key);
1743 continue;
1744 }
1745 sensitive_data.host_certificates[j] = key;
1746 debug("host certificate: #%u type %d %s", j, key->type,
1747 sshkey_type(key));
1748 }
1749
1750 if (use_privsep) {
1751 struct stat st;
1752
1753 if (getpwnam(SSH_PRIVSEP_USER) == NULL)
1754 fatal("Privilege separation user %s does not exist",
1755 SSH_PRIVSEP_USER);
1756 endpwent();
1757 if ((stat(_PATH_PRIVSEP_CHROOT_DIR, &st) == -1) ||
1758 (S_ISDIR(st.st_mode) == 0))
1759 fatal("Missing privilege separation directory: %s",
1760 _PATH_PRIVSEP_CHROOT_DIR);
1761 if (st.st_uid != 0 || (st.st_mode & (S_IWGRP|S_IWOTH)) != 0)
1762 fatal("%s must be owned by root and not group or "
1763 "world-writable.", _PATH_PRIVSEP_CHROOT_DIR);
1764 }
1765
1766 if (test_flag > 1) {
1767 /*
1768 * If no connection info was provided by -C then use
1769 * use a blank one that will cause no predicate to match.
1770 */
1771 if (connection_info == NULL)
1772 connection_info = get_connection_info(ssh, 0, 0);
1773 parse_server_match_config(&options, connection_info);
1774 dump_config(&options);
1775 }
1776
1777 /* Configuration looks good, so exit if in test mode. */
1778 if (test_flag)
1779 exit(0);
1780
1781 if (rexec_flag) {
1782 if (rexec_argc < 0)
1783 fatal("rexec_argc %d < 0", rexec_argc);
1784 rexec_argv = xcalloc(rexec_argc + 2, sizeof(char *));
1785 for (i = 0; i < (u_int)rexec_argc; i++) {
1786 debug("rexec_argv[%d]='%s'", i, saved_argv[i]);
1787 rexec_argv[i] = saved_argv[i];
1788 }
1789 rexec_argv[rexec_argc] = __UNCONST("-R");
1790 rexec_argv[rexec_argc + 1] = NULL;
1791 }
1792
1793 /* Ensure that umask disallows at least group and world write */
1794 new_umask = umask(0077) | 0022;
1795 (void) umask(new_umask);
1796
1797 /* Initialize the log (it is reinitialized below in case we forked). */
1798 if (debug_flag && (!inetd_flag || rexeced_flag))
1799 log_stderr = 1;
1800 log_init(__progname, options.log_level, options.log_facility, log_stderr);
1801
1802 /*
1803 * If not in debugging mode, not started from inetd and not already
1804 * daemonized (eg re-exec via SIGHUP), disconnect from the controlling
1805 * terminal, and fork. The original process exits.
1806 */
1807 already_daemon = daemonized();
1808 if (!(debug_flag || inetd_flag || no_daemon_flag || already_daemon)) {
1809
1810 if (daemon(0, 0) < 0)
1811 fatal("daemon() failed: %.200s", strerror(errno));
1812
1813 disconnect_controlling_tty();
1814 }
1815 /* Reinitialize the log (because of the fork above). */
1816 log_init(__progname, options.log_level, options.log_facility, log_stderr);
1817
1818 /* Chdir to the root directory so that the current disk can be
1819 unmounted if desired. */
1820 if (chdir("/") == -1)
1821 error("chdir(\"/\"): %s", strerror(errno));
1822
1823 /* ignore SIGPIPE */
1824 signal(SIGPIPE, SIG_IGN);
1825
1826 /* Get a connection, either from inetd or a listening TCP socket */
1827 if (inetd_flag) {
1828 server_accept_inetd(&sock_in, &sock_out);
1829 } else {
1830 server_listen();
1831
1832 signal(SIGHUP, sighup_handler);
1833 signal(SIGCHLD, main_sigchld_handler);
1834 signal(SIGTERM, sigterm_handler);
1835 signal(SIGQUIT, sigterm_handler);
1836
1837 /*
1838 * Write out the pid file after the sigterm handler
1839 * is setup and the listen sockets are bound
1840 */
1841 if (options.pid_file != NULL && !debug_flag) {
1842 FILE *f = fopen(options.pid_file, "w");
1843
1844 if (f == NULL) {
1845 error("Couldn't create pid file \"%s\": %s",
1846 options.pid_file, strerror(errno));
1847 } else {
1848 fprintf(f, "%ld\n", (long) getpid());
1849 fclose(f);
1850 }
1851 }
1852
1853 /* Accept a connection and return in a forked child */
1854 server_accept_loop(&sock_in, &sock_out,
1855 &newsock, config_s);
1856 }
1857
1858 /* This is the child processing a new connection. */
1859 setproctitle("%s", "[accepted]");
1860
1861 /*
1862 * Create a new session and process group since the 4.4BSD
1863 * setlogin() affects the entire process group. We don't
1864 * want the child to be able to affect the parent.
1865 */
1866 if (!debug_flag && !inetd_flag && setsid() < 0)
1867 error("setsid: %.100s", strerror(errno));
1868
1869 if (rexec_flag) {
1870 int fd;
1871
1872 debug("rexec start in %d out %d newsock %d pipe %d sock %d",
1873 sock_in, sock_out, newsock, startup_pipe, config_s[0]);
1874 dup2(newsock, STDIN_FILENO);
1875 dup2(STDIN_FILENO, STDOUT_FILENO);
1876 if (startup_pipe == -1)
1877 close(REEXEC_STARTUP_PIPE_FD);
1878 else if (startup_pipe != REEXEC_STARTUP_PIPE_FD) {
1879 dup2(startup_pipe, REEXEC_STARTUP_PIPE_FD);
1880 close(startup_pipe);
1881 startup_pipe = REEXEC_STARTUP_PIPE_FD;
1882 }
1883
1884 dup2(config_s[1], REEXEC_CONFIG_PASS_FD);
1885 close(config_s[1]);
1886
1887 execv(rexec_argv[0], rexec_argv);
1888
1889 /* Reexec has failed, fall back and continue */
1890 error("rexec of %s failed: %s", rexec_argv[0], strerror(errno));
1891 recv_rexec_state(REEXEC_CONFIG_PASS_FD, NULL);
1892 log_init(__progname, options.log_level,
1893 options.log_facility, log_stderr);
1894
1895 /* Clean up fds */
1896 close(REEXEC_CONFIG_PASS_FD);
1897 newsock = sock_out = sock_in = dup(STDIN_FILENO);
1898 if ((fd = open(_PATH_DEVNULL, O_RDWR, 0)) != -1) {
1899 dup2(fd, STDIN_FILENO);
1900 dup2(fd, STDOUT_FILENO);
1901 if (fd > STDERR_FILENO)
1902 close(fd);
1903 }
1904 debug("rexec cleanup in %d out %d newsock %d pipe %d sock %d",
1905 sock_in, sock_out, newsock, startup_pipe, config_s[0]);
1906 }
1907
1908 /* Executed child processes don't need these. */
1909 fcntl(sock_out, F_SETFD, FD_CLOEXEC);
1910 fcntl(sock_in, F_SETFD, FD_CLOEXEC);
1911
1912 /*
1913 * Disable the key regeneration alarm. We will not regenerate the
1914 * key since we are no longer in a position to give it to anyone. We
1915 * will not restart on SIGHUP since it no longer makes sense.
1916 */
1917 alarm(0);
1918 signal(SIGALRM, SIG_DFL);
1919 signal(SIGHUP, SIG_DFL);
1920 signal(SIGTERM, SIG_DFL);
1921 signal(SIGQUIT, SIG_DFL);
1922 signal(SIGCHLD, SIG_DFL);
1923
1924 /*
1925 * Register our connection. This turns encryption off because we do
1926 * not have a key.
1927 */
1928 if ((ssh = ssh_packet_set_connection(NULL, sock_in, sock_out)) == NULL)
1929 fatal("Unable to create connection");
1930 the_active_state = ssh;
1931 ssh_packet_set_server(ssh);
1932
1933 check_ip_options(ssh);
1934
1935 /* Prepare the channels layer */
1936 channel_init_channels(ssh);
1937 channel_set_af(ssh, options.address_family);
1938 process_permitopen(ssh, &options);
1939
1940 /* Set SO_KEEPALIVE if requested. */
1941 if (options.tcp_keep_alive && ssh_packet_connection_is_on_socket(ssh) &&
1942 setsockopt(sock_in, SOL_SOCKET, SO_KEEPALIVE, &on, sizeof(on)) < 0)
1943 error("setsockopt SO_KEEPALIVE: %.100s", strerror(errno));
1944
1945 if ((remote_port = ssh_remote_port(ssh)) < 0) {
1946 debug("ssh_remote_port failed");
1947 cleanup_exit(255);
1948 }
1949
1950 /*
1951 * The rest of the code depends on the fact that
1952 * ssh_remote_ipaddr() caches the remote ip, even if
1953 * the socket goes away.
1954 */
1955 remote_ip = ssh_remote_ipaddr(ssh);
1956
1957#ifdef LIBWRAP
1958 /* Check whether logins are denied from this host. */
1959 if (ssh_packet_connection_is_on_socket(ssh)) {
1960 struct request_info req;
1961
1962 request_init(&req, RQ_DAEMON, __progname, RQ_FILE, sock_in, 0);
1963 fromhost(&req);
1964
1965 if (!hosts_access(&req)) {
1966 debug("Connection refused by tcp wrapper");
1967 refuse(&req);
1968 /* NOTREACHED */
1969 fatal("libwrap refuse returns");
1970 }
1971 }
1972#endif /* LIBWRAP */
1973
1974 rdomain = ssh_packet_rdomain_in(ssh);
1975
1976 /* Log the connection. */
1977 laddr = get_local_ipaddr(sock_in);
1978 verbose("Connection from %s port %d on %s port %d%s%s%s",
1979 remote_ip, remote_port, laddr, ssh_local_port(ssh),
1980 rdomain == NULL ? "" : " rdomain \"",
1981 rdomain == NULL ? "" : rdomain,
1982 rdomain == NULL ? "" : "\"");
1983 free(laddr);
1984
1985 /* set the HPN options for the child */
1986 channel_set_hpn(options.hpn_disabled, options.hpn_buffer_size);
1987
1988 /*
1989 * We don't want to listen forever unless the other side
1990 * successfully authenticates itself. So we set up an alarm which is
1991 * cleared after successful authentication. A limit of zero
1992 * indicates no limit. Note that we don't set the alarm in debugging
1993 * mode; it is just annoying to have the server exit just when you
1994 * are about to discover the bug.
1995 */
1996 signal(SIGALRM, grace_alarm_handler);
1997 if (!debug_flag)
1998 alarm(options.login_grace_time);
1999
2000 if (kex_exchange_identification(ssh, -1, options.version_addendum) != 0)
2001 cleanup_exit(255); /* error already logged */
2002
2003 ssh_packet_set_nonblocking(ssh);
2004
2005 /* allocate authentication context */
2006 authctxt = xcalloc(1, sizeof(*authctxt));
2007 ssh->authctxt = authctxt;
2008
2009 /* XXX global for cleanup, access from other modules */
2010 the_authctxt = authctxt;
2011
2012 /* Set default key authentication options */
2013 if ((auth_opts = sshauthopt_new_with_keys_defaults()) == NULL)
2014 fatal("allocation failed");
2015
2016 /* prepare buffer to collect messages to display to user after login */
2017 if ((loginmsg = sshbuf_new()) == NULL)
2018 fatal("%s: sshbuf_new failed", __func__);
2019 auth_debug_reset();
2020
2021 if (use_privsep) {
2022 if (privsep_preauth(ssh) == 1)
2023 goto authenticated;
2024 } else if (have_agent) {
2025 if ((r = ssh_get_authentication_socket(&auth_sock)) != 0) {
2026 error("Unable to get agent socket: %s", ssh_err(r));
2027 have_agent = 0;
2028 }
2029 }
2030
2031 /* perform the key exchange */
2032 /* authenticate user and start session */
2033 do_ssh2_kex(ssh);
2034 do_authentication2(ssh);
2035
2036 /*
2037 * If we use privilege separation, the unprivileged child transfers
2038 * the current keystate and exits
2039 */
2040 if (use_privsep) {
2041 mm_send_keystate(ssh, pmonitor);
2042 ssh_packet_clear_keys(ssh);
2043 exit(0);
2044 }
2045
2046 authenticated:
2047 /*
2048 * Cancel the alarm we set to limit the time taken for
2049 * authentication.
2050 */
2051 alarm(0);
2052 signal(SIGALRM, SIG_DFL);
2053 authctxt->authenticated = 1;
2054 if (startup_pipe != -1) {
2055 close(startup_pipe);
2056 startup_pipe = -1;
2057 }
2058
2059#ifdef USE_PAM
2060 if (options.use_pam) {
2061 do_pam_setcred(1);
2062 do_pam_session(ssh);
2063 }
2064#endif
2065
2066 if (options.routing_domain != NULL)
2067 set_process_rdomain(ssh, options.routing_domain);
2068
2069 /*
2070 * In privilege separation, we fork another child and prepare
2071 * file descriptor passing.
2072 */
2073 if (use_privsep) {
2074 privsep_postauth(ssh, authctxt);
2075 /* the monitor process [priv] will not return */
2076 }
2077
2078 ssh_packet_set_timeout(ssh, options.client_alive_interval,
2079 options.client_alive_count_max);
2080
2081 /* Try to send all our hostkeys to the client */
2082 notify_hostkeys(ssh);
2083
2084 /* Start session. */
2085 do_authenticated(ssh, authctxt);
2086
2087#ifdef USE_PAM
2088 if (options.use_pam)
2089 finish_pam();
2090#endif /* USE_PAM */
2091
2092 /* The connection has been terminated. */
2093 ssh_packet_get_bytes(ssh, &ibytes, &obytes);
2094 verbose("Transferred: sent %llu, received %llu bytes",
2095 (unsigned long long)obytes, (unsigned long long)ibytes);
2096
2097 verbose("Closing connection to %.500s port %d", remote_ip, remote_port);
2098 ssh_packet_close(ssh);
2099
2100 if (use_privsep)
2101 mm_terminate();
2102
2103 exit(0);
2104}
2105
2106int
2107sshd_hostkey_sign(struct ssh *ssh, struct sshkey *privkey,
2108 struct sshkey *pubkey, u_char **signature, size_t *slenp,
2109 const u_char *data, size_t dlen, const char *alg)
2110{
2111 int r;
2112
2113 if (use_privsep) {
2114 if (privkey) {
2115 if (mm_sshkey_sign(ssh, privkey, signature, slenp,
2116 data, dlen, alg, ssh->compat) < 0)
2117 fatal("%s: privkey sign failed", __func__);
2118 } else {
2119 if (mm_sshkey_sign(ssh, pubkey, signature, slenp,
2120 data, dlen, alg, ssh->compat) < 0)
2121 fatal("%s: pubkey sign failed", __func__);
2122 }
2123 } else {
2124 if (privkey) {
2125 if (sshkey_sign(privkey, signature, slenp, data, dlen,
2126 alg, ssh->compat) < 0)
2127 fatal("%s: privkey sign failed", __func__);
2128 } else {
2129 if ((r = ssh_agent_sign(auth_sock, pubkey,
2130 signature, slenp, data, dlen, alg,
2131 ssh->compat)) != 0) {
2132 fatal("%s: agent sign failed: %s",
2133 __func__, ssh_err(r));
2134 }
2135 }
2136 }
2137 return 0;
2138}
2139
2140/* SSH2 key exchange */
2141static void
2142do_ssh2_kex(struct ssh *ssh)
2143{
2144 const char *myproposal[PROPOSAL_MAX] = { KEX_SERVER };
2145 struct kex *kex;
2146 int r;
2147
2148 myproposal[PROPOSAL_KEX_ALGS] = compat_kex_proposal(
2149 options.kex_algorithms);
2150
2151 if (strcmp(options.ciphers, KEX_SERVER_ENCRYPT) == 0 &&
2152 options.none_enabled == 1) {
2153 debug ("WARNING: None cipher enabled");
2154 myproposal[PROPOSAL_ENC_ALGS_CTOS] =
2155 myproposal[PROPOSAL_ENC_ALGS_STOC] = KEX_SERVER_ENCRYPT_INCLUDE_NONE;
2156 } else {
2157 myproposal[PROPOSAL_ENC_ALGS_CTOS] =
2158 myproposal[PROPOSAL_ENC_ALGS_STOC] = options.ciphers;
2159 }
2160
2161 myproposal[PROPOSAL_ENC_ALGS_CTOS] =
2162 compat_cipher_proposal(myproposal[PROPOSAL_ENC_ALGS_CTOS]);
2163 myproposal[PROPOSAL_ENC_ALGS_STOC] =
2164 compat_cipher_proposal(myproposal[PROPOSAL_ENC_ALGS_STOC]);
2165
2166 myproposal[PROPOSAL_MAC_ALGS_CTOS] =
2167 myproposal[PROPOSAL_MAC_ALGS_STOC] = options.macs;
2168
2169 if (options.compression == COMP_NONE) {
2170 myproposal[PROPOSAL_COMP_ALGS_CTOS] =
2171 myproposal[PROPOSAL_COMP_ALGS_STOC] = "none";
2172 }
2173
2174 if (options.rekey_limit || options.rekey_interval)
2175 ssh_packet_set_rekey_limits(ssh, options.rekey_limit,
2176 options.rekey_interval);
2177
2178 myproposal[PROPOSAL_SERVER_HOST_KEY_ALGS] = compat_pkalg_proposal(
2179 list_hostkey_types());
2180
2181 /* start key exchange */
2182 if ((r = kex_setup(ssh, myproposal)) != 0)
2183 fatal("kex_setup: %s", ssh_err(r));
2184 kex = ssh->kex;
2185#ifdef WITH_OPENSSL
2186 kex->kex[KEX_DH_GRP1_SHA1] = kex_gen_server;
2187 kex->kex[KEX_DH_GRP14_SHA1] = kex_gen_server;
2188 kex->kex[KEX_DH_GRP14_SHA256] = kex_gen_server;
2189 kex->kex[KEX_DH_GRP16_SHA512] = kex_gen_server;
2190 kex->kex[KEX_DH_GRP18_SHA512] = kex_gen_server;
2191 kex->kex[KEX_DH_GEX_SHA1] = kexgex_server;
2192 kex->kex[KEX_DH_GEX_SHA256] = kexgex_server;
2193 kex->kex[KEX_ECDH_SHA2] = kex_gen_server;
2194#endif
2195 kex->kex[KEX_C25519_SHA256] = kex_gen_server;
2196 kex->kex[KEX_KEM_SNTRUP4591761X25519_SHA512] = kex_gen_server;
2197 kex->load_host_public_key=&get_hostkey_public_by_type;
2198 kex->load_host_private_key=&get_hostkey_private_by_type;
2199 kex->host_key_index=&get_hostkey_index;
2200 kex->sign = sshd_hostkey_sign;
2201
2202 ssh_dispatch_run_fatal(ssh, DISPATCH_BLOCK, &kex->done);
2203
2204 session_id2 = kex->session_id;
2205 session_id2_len = kex->session_id_len;
2206
2207#ifdef DEBUG_KEXDH
2208 /* send 1st encrypted/maced/compressed message */
2209 packet_start(SSH2_MSG_IGNORE);
2210 packet_put_cstring("markus");
2211 packet_send();
2212 packet_write_wait();
2213#endif
2214 debug("KEX done");
2215}
2216
2217/* server specific fatal cleanup */
2218void
2219cleanup_exit(int i)
2220{
2221 if (i == 255)
2222 pfilter_notify(1);
2223
2224 if (the_active_state != NULL && the_authctxt != NULL) {
2225 do_cleanup(the_active_state, the_authctxt);
2226 if (use_privsep && privsep_is_preauth &&
2227 pmonitor != NULL && pmonitor->m_pid > 1) {
2228 debug("Killing privsep child %d", pmonitor->m_pid);
2229 if (kill(pmonitor->m_pid, SIGKILL) != 0 &&
2230 errno != ESRCH)
2231 error("%s: kill(%d): %s", __func__,
2232 pmonitor->m_pid, strerror(errno));
2233 }
2234 }
2235 _exit(i);
2236}
